channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2023120464
item.description:
Report X-2023120464

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1.X-2023120464 SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box with Flammable Liquid DOT diamond label found damaged on loadside. Package was placed in a lined tote for immediate transport to HMPA. No HAZ service code on barcode, no OP-900 or OP-950A paperwork attached, no UN number or Proper Shipping Name found on outer packaging. DescribePack: One of four 3.78 L plastic bottles lost 4oz of fluid due to a loose cap closure. Bottle appeared dented. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, tote lined, and area well ventilated. 2. X-2023120465 SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box with Flammable Liquid DOT diamond label found damaged on loadside. Package was placed in a lined tote for immediate transport to HMPA. No HAZ service code on barcode, no OP-900 or OP-950A paperwork attached, no UN number or Proper Shipping Name found on outer packaging. DescribePack: One of three 3.78 L plastic bottles lost 0.3L of fluid due to a loose cap closure. Bottle appeared dented. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, tote lined, and area well ventilated. 3. X-2023120467 SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box with Flammable Liquid DOT diamond label found damaged on loadside. Package was placed in a lined tote for immediate transport to HMPA. No HAZ service code on barcode, no OP-900 or OP-950A paperwork attached, no UN number or Proper Shipping Name found on outer packaging. DescribePack: One of four 3.78 L plastic bottles lost 2oz of fluid due to a loose cap closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, tote lined, and area well ventilated.

item.title: Report E-2023120060
item.description:
Report E-2023120060

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, (2) 55DF's containing Sulfuric Acid 1.500 (UN1830) fell over as a result of inadequate preparation for transportation forcing the bung caps to loosen and release 20-gallons of product on the pallet, the trailer floor, and the asphalt beneath the trailer. Contractors neutralized the release using sodium bicarbonate and solidified the liquid with oil dry. The impacted pallet was cut-up and containerized with the rest of the spill debris into (3) 55DF's for waste disposal. No storm drains, water ways, or soil were impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2023120036
item.description:
Report X-2023120036

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon the discovery of the package, it was promptly placed into a hazardous bag and then subsequently transferred into a red hazardous tote to mitigate any chance of additional spillage. The surrounding surfaces were also whipped down. The tote was then transferred to the HazMat QA station for further inspection. DescribePack: One of the 1-gallon bottles had a loose cap which resulted in a leakage when mishandled. Nearly half of the bottle had spilled and the box was nearly soaked in the liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was brought to our attention; it was placed into a plastic hazardous bag and then subsequently transferred into a red hazardous tote to mitigate any chance of additional spillage.

item.title: Report E-2023120014
item.description:
Report E-2023120014

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-28
  • City: GOODLETTSVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NNA experienced a customer location release of UN1203 Husqvarna 4-Stroke Fuel from 18 boxes each containing (4) 110-ounce metal cans. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 3’ x 3’ area of the pallet full of boxes of product. A total of 72 damaged cans and all impacted cardboard boxes were collected and containerized into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was transported to the XPO terminal located in Nashville, TN for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023111237
item.description:
Report X-2023111237

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-19
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box found mishandled on non-compatible belt rollers. No overhead scans on ftrack. Package removed from operations posthaste. DescribePack: Package was not oriented upward despite vented cap warnings on outer packaging. Two of four 5L plastic jerricans lost 0.3 gal of fluid due to lying on their side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used. The tote used for transporting damaged package and spillage was lined with a hazbag.

item.title: Report X-2023111231
item.description:
Report X-2023111231

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-18
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023111231 SequenceEvent: Admin noted leaking hazmat package on its side at APA / qa intercept / in overhead discharge chute at 21:30, 10/18. Package was removed from operations, placed in lined tote, and staged with note down at HMPA staging pallet. DescribePack: At least two of four 1 gallon plastic jerricans lost 0.1 gallon of fluid from internal corrosion of safety seals below cap closures due to mishandling. The package was sent up onto the overhead on the Unload and was diverted to the qa intercept / overhead discharge chute. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, tote lined to catch all spillage, and ventilation used. 2. X-2023111232 SequenceEvent: Admin noted leaking hazmat package on its side at APA / qa intercept / in overhead discharge chute at 21:30, 10/18. Package was removed from operations, placed in lined tote, and staged with note down at HMPA staging pallet. Please note that hazmat 786532313790 was impacted but experienced no internal spillage. DescribePack: At least two of four 1 gallon plastic jerricans lost 0.1 gallon of fluid from internal corrosion of safety seals below cap closures due to mishandling. The package was sent up onto the overhead on the Unload and was diverted to the qa intercept / overhead discharge chute. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, tote lined to catch all spillage, and ventilation used.

The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: Plastic pail had a loose cap, resulting in leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023110996
item.description:
Report X-2023110996

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-01
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A CN mechanical employee observed icing around the protective housing of tank car # UTLX 957945 along with a gas type odor while performing switching operations at the CN Harrison Yard in Memphis, TN. The CN Dangerous Goods Team was notified and responded to the rail yard to investigate. Upon arrival, the DGO observed a large ice buildup around the protective housing. Upon opening the housing, ice buildup was observed around the B end liquid valve. The valve was found to not be in the fully closed position with its securement plug less than tool tight (could turn by hand) allowing the tank cars contents to leak out. The liquid valve handle was hand tightened (approximately 1/4 turn) stopping the leak. The securement plug was removed, thread sealant applied, reinstalled and tightened with a pipe wrench. The railcar was released onto destination.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box containing fully regulated hazmat found in tote on HMPA staging pallet. No UNPOP markings found on box (cannot determine whether repack was attempted via spidr image) and (Limey Delimer) listed as technical name vs (urea sulphate). DescribePack: Two of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost at least 0.3 gallon of fluid due to loose cap closures. Please note that cap closures are vented and at least one orientation arrow label was found on the outer packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SDS consulted, PPE donned, and ventilation used.
